ground_truth: Jeff is sitting on the wheelchair near the bar, a drink in his hand. He starts to take a sip from the glass when Lisa comes out of the kitchen. She is an ethereal beauty, in a sheer peach nightgown, covered by a gossamer matching kimono. She turns gracefully in front of Jeff, and he lowers his drink. Instead of increasing her sobbing, this news quiets, momentarily, the woman who owned the dog. Her hands go down to the railing of the fire escape, gripping it fiercely. The guests at the songwriter's party begin to move silently back to the studio apartment, and the people move off their balcony into the apartment. The woman almost screams at the people now, as she looks up at the apartment. The husband leans over the fire escape and motions Miss Lonely Hearts to place the dog in the basket, which is already lowered. Miss Lonely Hearts puts the dog in the basket and watches as the husband draws it slowly up. The dog moves closer to the fire escape, slowly, the husband pulling the rope in hand over hand. The dog reaches the fire escape, and the husband tenderly takes it out of the basket. She breaks out sobbing anew and returns to her apartment and out of sight, the crying growing fainter with her retreat. He turns to carry it into the apartment. The newlyweds draw their shades again. The landlord moves away from the window. Miss Torso goes back to her apartment. Miss Hearing Aid turns down the volume of her hearing aid and goes back to her apartment. Jeff and Lisa are at the window, and he is holding one of her hands. Jeff speaks without looking up. Thorwald's apartment. The only light that can be seen in it is the glowing end of a cigar in the center of the room, back from the window -- as if Thorwald was sitting quietly on his sofa, smoking. Lisa looks down at Jeff. He nods solemnly and then turns back to the window, as both he and Lisa look again towards the dark apartment, with only the unmoving glow of a cigar showing in the center. Thorwald's apartment. Jeff, Stella, and Lisa are grouped at the window, looking out. The camera is behind them. Jeff holds the long-focus lens to his eye. In the bathroom, Thorwald is wiping the enameled wall with a damp cloth. He rubs at particular spots now and then. We see the upper part of the bedroom window, belonging to Thorwald. The lower part of the window is covered by a wall. Over this, we hear. Jeff lowers the camera with a long-focus lens. We now see their faces. Neither he nor Lisa makes any comment.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Jeff is comfortably seated in his wheelchair, positioned near the bar, with a drink held securely in his hand. As he begins to take a sip from the glass, Lisa emerges gracefully from the kitchen. She is an ethereal beauty, adorned in a sheer peach nightgown, elegantly complemented by a gossamer kimono of the same delicate hue. She turns with grace and poise in front of Jeff, prompting him to lower his drink in response to her presence. Instead of amplifying her sobbing, this news momentarily quiets the woman who owned the dog, her hands gripping the railing of the fire escape with fierce determination. The guests at the songwriter's lively party begin to move silently back into the cozy studio apartment, and the people gradually retreat from their balcony into the interior of the apartment. The woman almost screams at the people now, as she casts her gaze upward toward the apartment. The husband leans over the fire escape and gestures for Miss Lonely Hearts to place the dog into the basket, which has already been lowered in anticipation. Miss Lonely Hearts gently places the dog in the basket and watches intently as the husband carefully draws it up, hand over hand, with the rope. The dog moves closer to the fire escape, slowly, as the husband continues to pull the rope with steady hands. Once the dog reaches the fire escape, the husband tenderly lifts it out of the basket. She breaks out into sobbing anew and retreats to her apartment, disappearing from view, her cries growing fainter as she moves away. He turns to carry the dog into the apartment. The newlyweds draw their shades once again, seeking privacy. The landlord moves away from the window, while Miss Torso returns to her apartment. Miss Hearing Aid adjusts the volume of her hearing aid, turning it down, and goes back to her apartment. Jeff and Lisa remain at the window, with Jeff holding one of her hands gently. Jeff speaks without lifting his gaze. In Thorwald's apartment, the only visible light is the glowing end of a cigar in the center of the room, set back from the window, as if Thorwald is sitting quietly on his sofa, smoking in solitude. Lisa looks down at Jeff, who nods solemnly before turning back to the window. Together, they both look again towards the darkened apartment, where only the unmoving glow of a cigar is visible in the center. In Thorwald's apartment, Jeff, Stella, and Lisa are grouped at the window, peering out with intent focus. The camera is positioned behind them, capturing their watchful stance. Jeff holds the long-focus lens to his eye, observing intently. In the bathroom, Thorwald is seen wiping the enameled wall with a damp cloth, rubbing at particular spots with deliberate care. We catch a glimpse of the upper part of the bedroom window, belonging to Thorwald, while the lower part of the window is obscured by a wall. Over this scene, we hear the ambient sounds. Jeff lowers the camera with the long-focus lens, and we now see their faces, both Jeff and Lisa, neither of whom makes any comment, maintaining a silent vigil.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Jeff sits comfortably positioned in his wheelchair, located near the lively bar area, with a refreshing drink held securely and firmly in his hand. Just as he begins to bring the glass up to his lips for a sip, Lisa appears, emerging gracefully from the kitchen. She is an ethereal beauty personified, adorned in a delicate, sheer peach nightgown that is elegantly complemented by a gossamer kimono of the same soft and delicate hue. She turns with a gracefulness and poise in front of Jeff, prompting him to lower his drink in response to her captivating presence.

Instead of amplifying her sobs, this piece of news momentarily quiets the woman who owned the beloved dog, as her hands grip the railing of the fire escape with fierce determination and emotional intensity. Meanwhile, the guests at the songwriter's lively and bustling party begin to move silently back into the cozy, inviting studio apartment, as people gradually retreat from their positions on the balcony into the more intimate interior of the apartment. The woman almost screams at the people now, as her eyes cast upward, gazing toward the apartment with a mixture of frustration and urgency. Her husband leans over the fire escape and gestures for Miss Lonely Hearts to place the dog into the basket, which has already been carefully lowered in anticipation.

Miss Lonely Hearts tenderly places the dog in the basket and watches intently as the husband draws it up carefully, hand over hand, using the rope with steady precision. The dog moves ever closer to the fire escape, slowly and cautiously, as the husband continues to pull the rope with careful, steady hands. Once the dog has reached the fire escape's safe haven, the husband tenderly lifts it out of the basket with gentle care. She breaks out into sobbing anew, retreating to her apartment and disappearing from view, with her cries growing fainter as she moves away. The husband turns with purpose to carry the dog into the apartment. The newlyweds draw their shades once again, seeking some privacy from the outside world.

The landlord moves away from the window, while Miss Torso returns to her own apartment. Miss Hearing Aid, adjusting her hearing aid's volume, turning it down, goes back to her apartment. Jeff and Lisa remain at the window, with Jeff holding one of her hands gently and affectionately. Jeff speaks, not lifting his gaze. In Thorwald's apartment, the only visible light is the glowing end of a cigar, situated in the center of the room, set back from the window, as if Thorwald is sitting quietly on his sofa, smoking in solitude. Lisa looks down at Jeff, who nods solemnly before turning back to the window. Together, they both look intently once again towards the darkened apartment, where only the unmoving glow of a cigar remains visible in the center.

In Thorwald's apartment, Jeff, Stella, and Lisa are grouped closely at the window, peering out with an intent and focused gaze. The camera is positioned behind them, capturing their watchful, vigilant stance. Jeff holds the long-focus lens up to his eye, observing the scene with intent focus. In the bathroom, Thorwald is seen wiping the enameled wall with a damp cloth, rubbing at particular spots with deliberate and careful attention. We catch a glimpse of the upper part of the bedroom window that belongs to Thorwald, while the lower part of the window is obscured by a wall. Over this scene, we hear the ambient sounds filling the air. Jeff lowers the camera with the long-focus lens, and we now see their faces, both Jeff and Lisa, neither of whom makes any comment, maintaining a silent vigil, absorbed in their watchful observation.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jeff is seated comfortably in his wheelchair near the bar, holding a drink in his hand. He begins to raise the glass to his lips, preparing to take a sip, when Lisa emerges from the kitchen. She appears as an ethereal beauty, adorned in a sheer peach nightgown that is elegantly covered by a matching gossamer kimono. As she moves with grace in front of Jeff, he is captivated and lowers his drink, momentarily pausing to take in her presence. Meanwhile, the news that had been expected to increase the woman's sobbing instead quiets her momentarily. Her hands descend to the railing of the fire escape, where she grips it fiercely, channeling her emotions into the metal. At the songwriter's party, the guests begin to move silently, retreating back into the studio apartment, while others on the balcony also make their way inside. The woman, feeling a surge of emotion, almost screams at the people as she looks up towards the apartment. Her husband leans over the fire escape, gesturing to Miss Lonely Hearts to place the dog into the basket that has already been lowered for this purpose. Miss Lonely Hearts carefully places the dog into the basket and watches intently as the husband begins to draw it up slowly, hand over hand, pulling the rope with care. The dog gradually moves closer to the fire escape, and once it reaches the top, the husband tenderly lifts it out of the basket. The woman, overwhelmed by her emotions, breaks into sobs once more and retreats into her apartment, her cries growing fainter as she moves out of sight. The husband then turns to carry the dog into the apartment. Meanwhile, the newlyweds draw their shades again, seeking privacy. The landlord steps away from the window, and Miss Torso returns to her apartment. Miss Hearing Aid adjusts the volume of her hearing aid, turning it down before heading back to her apartment. Jeff and Lisa remain at the window, with Jeff holding one of Lisa's hands. Jeff speaks, his gaze still fixed on the scene outside. In Thorwald's apartment, the only visible light is the glowing end of a cigar, positioned in the center of the room, away from the window, suggesting that Thorwald is sitting quietly on his sofa, smoking. Lisa glances down at Jeff, who nods solemnly, acknowledging the situation, before turning back to the window. Together, they both look again towards the dark apartment, where the only sign of life is the unmoving glow of a cigar in the center. In Thorwald's apartment, Jeff, Stella, and Lisa are gathered at the window, peering out with focused attention. The camera captures them from behind as Jeff holds the long-focus lens to his eye, scrutinizing the scene. In the bathroom, Thorwald is seen wiping the enameled wall with a damp cloth, occasionally rubbing at specific spots with intent. The upper part of Thorwald's bedroom window is visible, while the lower part is obscured by a wall. Over this scene, we hear the ambient sounds. Jeff lowers the camera with the long-focus lens, revealing their faces, which remain silent and contemplative, as neither he nor Lisa makes any comment.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Jeff sits in his wheelchair near the bar, holding a drink, as Lisa emerges from the kitchen in a sheer peach nightgown and matching kimono. Lisa looks at Jeff, who nods solemnly before they both turn back to the window, focusing on the dark apartment with the cigar's glow. Jeff, Stella, and Lisa are grouped at the window, with Jeff using a long-focus lens to observe Thorwald wiping the enameled bathroom wall. They see the upper part of Thorwald's bedroom window, partially obscured by a wall, and remain silent as Jeff lowers the camera.

Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. Miss Hearing Aid turns down the volume of her hearing aid and goes back to her apartment. Jeff and Lisa are at the window and he is holding one of her hands. Jeff speaks without looking up Thorwald's apartment. The only light that can be seen in it is the glowing end of a cigar in the center of the room back from the window  as if Thorwald was sitting quietly on his sofa smoking. Lisa looks down at Jeff. He nods solemnly and then turns back to the window as both he and Lisa look again towards the dark apartment with only the unmoving glow of a cigar showing in the center Thorwald's apartment. Jeff Stella and Lisa are grouped at the window looking out. The camera is behind them. Jeff holds the longfocus lens to his eye. In the bathroom Thorwald is wiping the enameled wall with a damp cloth. He rubs at particular spots now and then. We see the upper part of the bedroom window belonging to Thorwald. The lower part of the window is covered by a wall. Over this we hear. Jeff lowers the camera with a longfocus lens. We now see their faces. Neither he nor Lisa makes any comment.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Jeff is sitting on the wheelchair near the bar a drink in his hand. He starts to take a sip from the glass when Lisa comes out of the kitchen. She is an ethereal beauty in a sheer peach nightgown covered by a gossamer matching kimono. She turns gracefully in front of Jeff and he lowers his drink. Instead of increasing her sobbing this news quiets momentarily the woman who owned the dog. Her hands go down to the railing of the fire escape gripping it fiercely. The guests at the songwriter's party begin to move silently back to the studio apartment and the people move off their balcony into the apartment. The woman almost screams at the people now as she looks up at the apartment. The husband leans over the fire escape and motions Miss Lonely Hearts to place the dog in the basket which is already lowered. In the bathroom Thorwald is wiping the enameled wall with a damp cloth. He rubs at particular spots now and then. We see the upper part of the bedroom window belonging to Thorwald. The lower part of the window is covered by a wall. Over this we hear. Jeff lowers the camera with a longfocus lens. We now see their faces. Neither he nor Lisa makes any comment.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~80%)
test_cases.description: Jeff is sitting on the wheelchair near the bar a drink in his hand. He starts to take a sip from the glass when Lisa comes out of the kitchen. She is an ethereal beauty in a sheer peach nightgown covered by a gossamer matching kimono. She turns gracefully in front of Jeff and he lowers his drink. Jeff lowers the camera with a longfocus lens. We now see their faces. Neither he nor Lisa makes any comment.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Tim reclines on the hammock near the treehouse, a book in his grasp. He begins to flip a page from the novel when Carla emerges from the tent. She is a radiant presence, in a translucent emerald cloak, draped by a delicate matching shawl. She dances nimbly in front of Tim, and he closes his book. Instead of amplifying her laughter, this story pacifies, momentarily, the girl who owned the cat. Her fingers reach up to the branches of the climbing frame, holding them tightly. The visitors at the painter's gathering start to drift quietly back to the gallery, and the attendees shift off their hammock into the gallery. The girl nearly whispers at the attendees now, as she gazes up at the gallery. The partner bends over the climbing frame and signals Miss Hopeful to place the cat in the box, which is already lifted. Miss Hopeful places the cat in the box and watches as the partner hoists it gently up. The cat shifts closer to the climbing frame, gently, the partner pulling the cord in hand over hand. The cat reaches the climbing frame, and the partner softly takes it out of the box. She bursts out laughing anew and returns to her gallery and out of sight, the laughter growing softer with her departure. He pivots to carry it into the gallery. The vacationers draw their curtains again. The janitor steps away from the entrance. Miss Dancer goes back to her gallery. Miss Sound Mixer lowers the setting of her sound mixer and retreats to her gallery. Tim and Carla are at the entrance, and he is clasping one of her fingers. Tim speaks without diverting his gaze. Palmer's gallery. The only light that can be spotted in it is the shimmering tip of a candle in the middle of the room, away from the entrance -- as if Palmer was reclining silently on his armchair, reading. Carla glances down at Tim. He shakes his head gravely and then turns back to the entrance, as both he and Carla focus again towards the dim gallery, with only the unchanging flicker of a candle visible in the center. Palmer's gallery. Tim, Chloe, and Carla are arranged at the entrance, peering out. The lens is behind them. Tim holds the long-focus telescope to his gaze. In the shower, Palmer is scrubbing the tiled surface with a moist sponge. He polishes at certain sections now and then. We see the upper segment of the living room window, belonging to Palmer. The lower part of the window is obscured by a blanket. Above this, we overhear. Tim lowers the telescope with a long-focus lens. We now perceive their expressions. Neither he nor Carla remarks any observation.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Jeff sits in a wheelchair near a bar with a drink when Lisa, dressed in a sheer nightgown with a matching kimono, emerges from the kitchen. The commotion outside quietens a sobbing woman who owned a dog, as her focus shifts to a fire escape where a husband retrieves the dog using a basket. After returning to her apartment in tears, the surrounding neighbors resume their activities: Miss Lonely Hearts, the newlyweds, Miss Torso, and Miss Hearing Aid all go back to their routines. Jeff and Lisa, at the window, hold hands and watch Thorwald's dark apartment, where only the glow of a cigar is visible. Joined by Stella, they observe Thorwald through a long-focus lens as he cleans his bathroom wall. Despite the intensity of the moment, Jeff and Lisa remain silent.
